fields.description:
During the 6.0.2-SNAPSHOT blitz I created a MAN (MANCHESTER) project and tried to view the issues in the Classic Task BOard.

They did not show.  Martin and I could not work out why this is the case and hence raised this issue.

h3. Problem

The project was created from GH's Getting Started page, using the new Simplified Workflow. This workflow employs statuses "To Do", "In Progress", "Done".

Upon viewing the Classic Task Board, the mapping is set by GreenHopper to map the To Do column to use the JIRA default statuses, instead of our "To Do" status. Likewise for the Done column. The In Progress column is correctly mapped to the "In Progress" status.

This is why no issues are visible - because all the issues are in To Do status.

To fix the problem, just go to the Configuration of the Task Board and adjust the mappings of statuses to columns.

fields.description:
While we can appreciate how nicely the new Rapid Boards will fit into our development cycles there are a few things that we would like to see changed.
1. DISPLAY ACCEPTANCE TESTS - When you are on the Planning Board and you are looking at a story the story displays on the right hand side of the screen, it would be very beneficial to show the acceptance tests within that view. Oftentimes during our Sprint Planning sessions we review the stories with the teams and then read through the acceptance tests in order to develop an accurate estimate.
2. CREATION OF STORIES - When creating a story on the Planning Board within the new rapid board it would be nice to easily rank the story that you are creating within the backlog immediately without having to add it and then having to drag and drop it from the bottom to where it's priority should be. Oftentimes, I already know the priority for the story when I am creating it and don't want it to always go to the bottom and then I have to rank it later.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-5691].
  {panel}

COS: 
- Something in the filter tab 
- Click through to the column tab

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: Alert? Dialog? Dismissable?
A: Warning, shown in Filter tab. Not dismissable. 

Q: Count of issues not displayed?
A: Nope

Q: Do you get this message as soon as there exists an issue which is unmapped?
A: Whenever you view the filters tab and there is an issue unmapped (current user). Other users on page refresh/load of configuration.

Q: Is this only for statuses that currently have issues in them, or any unmapped status?
A: Only unmapped statuses that have issues in them. 

Q: Does the message immediately disappear when the last applicable status becomes mapped?
A: Yes, once you fix the last unmapped status with issues, then view the filters tab, it no longer appears (current user). Other users on page refresh/load of configuration.

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*

Create an issue with an original estimate of 8 hours. The log work for 8 hours, automatically adjusting remaining estimate.

Current status should be 8h Original Estimate (OE), 8 Hours Time Spent (TS), 0 Hours Remaining Estimate (RE)

Now log work again, this time working 1 hour and adjusting the RE to 2h.

Then edit that work log, so that the 1 hour worked is now 2.5, and the RE is 0.5h instead of 2h.

Now create a new sprint and add just this issue to it. 

*Expected Behaviour:*

As of the last update before being added into the sprint, the issue had 30minutes remaining. I would expect the RE to be 30 minutes in the Burndown Chart

*Actual Behaviour:*

It will end up being reporting as having negative 1.5 hours remaining.

*Other info:*

Michael R says it's possibly because it's parsing the edited entry and not the other change.
fields.summary: Burndown Chart Does Not Calculate Edited Worklogs Correctly

fields.description:
I started to work a with the (Rapid) Board … but I must confess that I’m missing hardly some features which gives me a better “helicopter view” - and not only a limited sprint (plan mode) and active tasks focus (work).

Yes - I'm aware of all the concepts of agile development.

But this does not replace an overall vision where do you want to go.

_*It's just not being able to see the forest for the trees*_

So the goal is to have e.g. an overview about potential releases (e.g. quarterly based) and one up to thirty epics per release.

Target group: Product Management, C-Level

I think this is one of the essential downsides compared to the "classic" mode.

We are still working in classic mode on 24" monitors and small fonts - and it provides an _excellent overview_ compared to the new board which takes the complete screen.

No - I won't expect a UI which is useable on every device (smartphone, tablet) - to the contrary if this would lead to "one-size-fits-all" approach just to ride the mobile device wave.

Next to that, we need to drag and drop Epics from release to release, quarter to quarter (or sprint to sprint which is usually around +/- 2 weeks) - so ideally based on the the complete long list of all items.


I took a look to the Pivotaltracker (e.g. Public project: Open Tapestry https://www.pivotaltracker.com/projects/102714/stories ) and I discovered immediately some real neat features I really would like to see in GH.


So I’m not suggesting to extend the current "plan" mode, but adding an additional mode like "big picture mode", "forrests mode" or  "vision" mode – some kind of "zoom out".


Looking forward for your feedback.
fields.summary: A "helicopter view" or "vision mode" for a big picture next to sprint and task focused views (forrests and trees)

fields.description:
In the pages mentioned here (in _Environment_ issue field), it is mentioned that
{quote}
A Cumulative Flow Diagram (CFD) is an area chart that shows work-in-progress for a product, version or *sprint*. The horizontal x-axis in a CFD indicates time, and the vertical y-axis indicates cards (issues). Each coloured area of the chart equates to a workflow status (i.e. a column on your board).
{quote}

This might create false hopes regarding the fact that the Cumulative Flow Diagram Report in GH 6 shows the whole sprint but the Cumulative Flow Chart Diagram Gadget only works with the old fixVersion concept.

Assuming I am not missing something, can we please edit these pages in order not to raise false hopes and point to the wrong direction?

Many thanks. (y)
fields.summary: Cumulative Flow Diagram Gadget does not work with Rapid Board Sprint, only a version (fixVersion)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This issue was originally opened for sprint support in the Classic Cumulative Flow Diagram gadget. It has since become a mixture of that request and the need for the same gadget for the (newer) Agile board report.
So I will change the original summary to reflect this state.



---
*Original summary*
Wallboard Cumulative Flow Chart Gadget cannot work with Rapid Board Sprints

*Original description*

{color:#707070}This comes from a dedicated customer using the Cumulative Flow Chart Gadget with the Classic Planning Board.

Reproduction steps:
# You create a new Rapid Board, named RP1 (e.g. a Scrum one). In RP1 you include two projects, Pr1 and Pr2.
# Then you create a Sprint, named S1
# In RP1, you drag and drop issues from both Pr1 and Pr2 to S1.
# Unlike the classic Planning Board (where issues are actually transferred into versions of the actual one project they are related to), issues are only transferred into S1. This is visible on the bottom right part of the issue in JIRA (under the Agile section)
# In RP1, you can click on Report and then, instead of Sprint Report, select Cumulative Flow Diagram. This depicts the Cumulative Flow Diagram for S1 (and can act as a temporary workaround) but:
# This is something you cannot have in the GreenHopper Cumulative Flow Chart Dashboard Gadget (also Wallboard capable) as you can only select a version, not a sprint.

Question: Shouldn't the Cumulative Flow Chart Gadget be able to work with Sprints instead of versions only?{color}
fields.summary: Ability to show the Cumulative Flow Diagram report as a gadget

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If a customer has an export from a JIRA that has a recent version of GreenHopper (where GH's licence is stored in the UPM) and imports this into OnDemand, the GH licence will be imported along with the JIRA data.

This licence will take priority over OnDemand's GH licence and GH will not work until a support engineer manually removes the licence from the database and restarts JIRA, which is quite disruptive to the customer.

OnDemand JIRA Importer can strip the UPM license. However, the stripping code will break when either UPM or GH changes license-related code. So the best fix would be for GreenHopper to revert the priority. In fact, it should never use UPM license as the UPM license UI is disabled in OnDemand mode. There is no way for customers to update their license through UPM.
fields.summary: GreenHopper in OnDemand should never use UPM license

fields.description:
The Task Board is good, the rapid board has some catching up to do in terms of user experience (5.9.4 rapid board).

The rapid board should certainly have the progress bar & hours that the task board has now, they are very useful during a sprint (actually the progress bar should give an option between hours vs. # of tasks).

That feature alone might keeps us from migrating to the rapid board (though in general terms the UI of the Task Board still is organized better than the rapid board).
fields.summary: Rapid board should have the progress bar & sprint task hours left from the Task Board

fields.summary: Stacktrace when I clicked on "Agile"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Detail view edit not reflected in active sprint issues on Plan mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Its just nice to do a quick hours remaining calculation sometimes and we have grown very used to having this in the current version. Please can we have this back.
fields.summary: As a greenhopper 6 rapid board user I want to see a rapid report with hours so that I can see and track the teams hours remaining on a sprint.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a business we cannot move to the new rapid boards unless we have this feature so its really critical for us and blocks us from upgrading any futher.

We have 3 teams working on 1 project and from 1 backlog. So each team has a filter to show certian parts of the backlog. They will add thier stories to the sprints. The problem is each team wants to see thier own reports (as defined by filters). The story defined would seem to solve this problem.
fields.summary: As a greenhopper 6 user I want the Quick Filters available on the Rapid Board Report view (as in Plan and Work mode) so that I can view reports by filter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed several reflected and persisted cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities that affect GreenHopper instances, including publicly available instances (that is, Internet-facing servers). XSS vulnerabilities allow an attacker to embed their own JavaScript into a GreenHopper page.

More details are available in the advisory at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+Security+Advisory+2012-08-21
fields.summary: Cross Site Scripting Vulnerabilities

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I would like to be able to configure a column to always show issues of Project X in status Z. Or Project X, issue type z. Or any combination of those things.

The reason behind that is that our developer team wants to always be automatically aware of issues escalated by support team. We don't want to have to check the backlog of the Sprint and manually add the issues. We want them to appear automatically.
fields.summary: As an Scrum Rapid Board Administrator, I would like to have a column automatically populated whe an issue gets to a pre-defined status

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: If you copy a rapid board, and then try to change to shared settings on the copy, (removing shared with all for example), the original board also gets updated with the change in the visibility changes.
fields.summary: Copies of boards share the same sharing configuration

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
From Mark Halvorson: 

The bug occurs when any subsequent boards are associated with a project based on the simplified workflow.

Here is a screencast that demonstrates the problem.

1)  Create Project & Board associated with simplified workflow.
2)  View configure screen and workflow.  All looks good.
3)  Go create a 2nd board associated with the same project.
4)  View configuration screen.  See extra status options that are not part of my workflow.  Ooops.
5)  View workflow.  Confirm that the status options are not part of my workflow.
6)  Drag any of these invalid status options to the unmapped columns area and they simply disappear.. thus re-affirming to me that they should not have been there.

So it appears the bug is that In order to create additional boards that share the same project the user has to go fix the column mappings.
fields.summary: Second board on project using simplified workflow shows statuses that aren't part of the workflow

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Coming from a dedicated GreenHopper customer:

In GreenHopper 6.0.1 you can add plan ahead using multiple sprint markers which is great.

However, you cannot add sprint name and dates until you actually _start_ the sprint and that would be great to have as a functionality.

fields.description:
Guys, you've made incompatible changes to ranking API in 5.10.6 (in a patch version!) causing our plugin to lose connectivity with GreenHopper and some feedback from our customers -- this made me write this story.

1. Stability

I would like GreenHopper API to follow the same rules JIRA API follows. Backward-incompatible changes would advance major API version; forward-incompatible changes would advance minor API version; implementation details change would advance micro version.

I would suggest that unlike JIRA, GreenHopper API have its own version number, independent from GreenHopper plugin version. This will allow you to advance API version in minor releases - but it will be an explicit, visible change (which hopefully you'd mention in the Release Notes).

2. Usability

Right now we have to extract GreenHopper classes and instances with reflection, because there's no compile-time artifact that we can depend on. The API should be a separate artifact that both GreenHopper main body and the outside plugin can depend on. 

This artifact should have its own versioning (see above) and be published along with the sources for the API -- before or at the same time GreenHopper version using that API version is released.

Thanks for listening!
fields.summary: As a plugin developer, I'd like to have stable, usable GreenHopper API

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In one support case, a user was probably exploring what the "Planning Board" under the context of a project that did not have any version but more than 11,000 issues (as the project seemed to be used to track customer support cases). For the request, 11,010 issues were loaded in the memory, and due to the fact that these issues were not found in the timeline cache, they were calculated from database one by one. The calculating of work log summary for 11,000+ issues from database obviously took a while and the user most likely refreshed the page a few times. And this led to OOME.

We would advise the customer not to enable GH on all projects to avoid this in the future.

But it would be good to check whether the logged in user has the permission to add new versions if that the project does not have any versions and decline the request if the user does not have permissions to add versions. And even if they do, it would be nice to ask them to confirm that they want to use versions in the project.

And while computing the work log summary, it would be great to update the calculation in while it is still in progress so that the user does not get frustrated for the long wait.
fields.summary: Better handling of "Planning Board" under the context of a project that has no version but lots of issues
